qas.question: What does Auto didacticism generally mean?
When can you become an Autodidact?
Which famous U.S president was a Autodidact?
Which famous inventor was a Autodidact?
What is a non-contemplative, absorbing process?
When can you not become an Autodidact?
Which U.S president was not an Autodidact?
Which famous inventor was not an Autodidact?
What engineer was not an autodidact?

context: Autodidacticism (also autodidactism) is a <b4_0>contemplative, absorbing process<b4_0/>, of "<a0_0>learning on your own<a0_0/>" or "by yourself", or as a self-teacher. Some autodidacts spend a great deal of time reviewing the resources of libraries and educational websites. One may become an autodidact <b5_0>at nearly <a1_0>any point<b5_0/> in one's life<a1_0/>. While some may have been informed in a conventional manner in a particular field, they may choose to inform themselves in other, often unrelated areas. Notable autodidacts include <a2_0><b6_0>Abraham Lincoln<b6_0/><a2_0/> (U.S. president), Srinivasa Ramanujan (mathematician), Michael Faraday (chemist and physicist), Charles Darwin (naturalist), <a3_0><b7_0>Thomas Alva Edison<b7_0/><a3_0/> (inventor), Tadao Ando (architect), George Bernard Shaw (playwright), Frank Zappa (composer, recording engineer, film director), and <b8_0>Leonardo da Vinci<b8_0/> (engineer, scientist, mathematician).
